title: How seriously do you take reports?
body: I wonder about this. There are clearly some very toxic people who have been playing this game for a long time, and do things just to piss off their teammates. I understand that if you report these people and they are punished, you will be notified of it. But that only happens when your whole team and several others from the enemy do as well. In which case a robot bans them instead of someone actually taking a look at what happened. So I ask again, how seriously are reports actually taken? And are people punished more often because one person reported them or because many did?

replies.body:
Let's get this one out of the way real quick;

> And are people punished more often because one person reported them or because many did?

Nope. Any number of reports (more than zero) does the exact same thing; they trigger a review for that player's behavior in the match. Reviews don't have any kind of strength or intensity, so more reports can't make it check any harder, and 1 report is the same as 9 in a match.

>  I understand that if you report these people and they are punished, you will be notified of it.

You don't always get this feedback, and it can only happen when they are immediately punished due to the review triggered by your report in that match. If the behavior in their next game pushes them over the edge for a punishment, you won't be notified even though your report did contribute to that happening. Basically, don't get hung up on not getting notified, it's very uncommon.

>  In which case a robot bans them instead of someone actually taking a look at what happened. So I ask again, how seriously are reports actually taken?

The automated Instant Feedback System reviews the severity and frequency of their behavior and issues a punishment (or not) based on what it finds and what punishment tier they are already on. If they are frequently toxic they'll likely end up punished and get escalated up the tiers one at a time as they continue doing it. If they are extremely toxic (like using hate speech) you can skip multiple tiers straight to a 14 day or permanent account ban.

Thanks for the in-depth reply. 

How long does it take to reset from the automated feedback system? And why is it that many people I know still claim to have been punished for not doing anything wrong but getting reported by many people?

> How long does it take to reset from the automated feedback system?

What do you mean by that?

> And why is it that many people I know still claim to have been punished for not doing anything wrong but getting reported by many people?

Because they don't understand what they did wrong or they don't care. You are never notified who reported you, so blaming it on mass reports is a red herring; they get a reform card for their punishment, so they can provide that to discuss it here if they are confused. It is definitely not because of multiple reports, it's because of their behavior.
Learn how the report system works before making a topic on reporting. One report has the same weight as many reports on a single person.

Okay that is CLEARLY not true. I have had friends report each other just for the heck of it. They all reported one single person and he got banned due to 'toxicity', even though he didn't type in chat since they were all using headsets lol. But he got banned. He does not play league anymore because of that.
Perhaps instead of calling one ignorant, you could enlighten. Isn't this also a form of toxicity? Don't even post about forum behavior if you don't follow the rules that you want others to.
Then why are you even on here?
No, clearly not. I'm not a troll. I am here to learn. It was a sincere question. Enjoy the report.
I won't trust your toxic friend too much in that regards.

People can report me all they want in game, those reports do nothing to me if I haven't broken the TOU.

So how seriously do I take people threatening to report me? None at all.
